name: doola
headline: Business-in-a-Boxâ¢ for LLCs
description: doola is a âBusiness-in-a-Boxâ for creators. We take care of everything creators need to form an LLC, set up their bank account, accept payments, and manage ongoing compliance and tax filings. We realized how difficult it was to set up the full stack of software and accounts you need to get a business off the ground. This is the same problem faced by online businesses, who begin their business as a side hustle, and just want to focus on growing their business, not annoying administrative work. Thatâs why we built doola: to take care of it all. Today, people on every continent have launched companies with doola. (HQ: New York)

founders.name: Arjun Mahadevan, Founder
founders.description: CEO @doolaHQ (YC S20) | Helping 1M people start their dream biz with doola.com (a âbusiness-in-a-boxâ for LLCs) | Slowly turning into my alter ego: Mr. LLC ðºð¸

# Start your U.S. business from anywhere in the world
From Business Formation to Bookkeeping and Taxes, we’ve got your back at every step.
[Start your business![right arrow](https://www.doola.com/wp-content/themes/doola2/resources/images/icons/chevron-right-alt.svg)](https://www.doola.com/<https:/app.doola.com/>)

## All-in-one company formation services
#### Start Your U.S. Business
We help you start your business in the United States, ensuring compliance from day one.
[Learn more ](https://www.doola.com/<#timeline>)
#### Business Documentation
Get essential documents for banking, taxes, and e-commerce, including an operating agreement and articles of organization.
[Learn more ](https://www.doola.com/<https:/www.doola.com/university/what-documents-are-required-to-form-a-company/>)
#### Registered Agent Service
We provide a trusted Registered Agent to receive important business documents on your behalf, keeping your business compliant.
[Learn more ](https://www.doola.com/</products/registered-agent/>)
#### Sales Tax & Reseller Certificate
Setup your business for sales tax and get a reseller certificate, ensuring compliance while unlocking tax-exempt purchasing for your business.
[Learn more ](https://www.doola.com/</products/sales-tax-registration-and-reseller-certificate/>)
#### Dedicated Bookkeeping
We manage your books while our software syncs with your bank accounts and Stripe, tracking and categorizing every transaction.
[Learn more ](https://www.doola.com/</bookkeeping/>)
#### Business Taxes
We handle your annual tax paperwork with our in-house tax and CPA teams to maintain good standings and avoid hefty penalties.
[Learn more ](https://www.doola.com/</bookkeeping/tax-filing/>)
## The quick path to forming your business
[Start your business![right arrow](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%2016%2016'%3E%3C/svg%3E)](https://www.doola.com/<https:/app.doola.com/>)
[Free consultation](https://www.doola.com/<https:/doola.com/free-consultation/>)
Step 1
### Submit your information through our user-friendly Dashboard
To kick off the process, you’ll need to provide some basic information about your future business.
  * Company information (Preferred name, entity type, state, and a few other basics)
  * Members information (Legal name, address, ownership, and a few additional details)


15 minutes
Step 2
### Start your U.S. company in any of the 50 states
We help you set up everything you need to start your business in any state.
  * Company Formation in any U.S. state
  * Operating Agreement & Articles of Organization
  * Registered Agent Service for secure document handling


1 week (on average)
Step 3
### Secure your Business Documentation 
We secure your Business Documents needed for opening a business bank account, hiring employees, and filing taxes.
  * Essential Business Documents


1 – 2 business days (US residents)  4-6 weeks (on average) (non-US residents)
Step 4
### Set up yourU.S. bank account
Once you get your business documents, you can apply for a U.S. bank account through our partner portal
  * Business Documents required
  * Passport required (for international clients)


3 – 5 business days 
Step 5
### Run & growyour business
Your business is fully set up and compliant, so you’re ready to dive into your work with confidence.
  * Additional Services Keep your company on track with our bookkeeping and tax services.
  * Stay Compliant For full compliance support, consider starting with Total Compliance.


[Start your business![right arrow](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%2016%2016'%3E%3C/svg%3E)](https://www.doola.com/<https:/app.doola.com/>)
## Find the best structure for your needs
[Take our quiz ](https://www.doola.com/<https:/doolahq.typeform.com/to/Hxzf2zef>)
  * LLC
  * C-Corp
  * S-Corp


![Home](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20825%20750'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
Siddharth is an
Amazon Seller who
started a  US LLC
from  India.
### Limited Liability Companies (LLC)
A Limited Liability Company (LLC) is a flexible business structure in the U.S. that offers personal liability protection and can have one or multiple owners (called members). It’s popular among small business owners and entrepreneurs for its simplicity and tax flexibility.
  * Limited liability protection for owners
  * Simple management structure and easy to operate
  * Unlimited owners (U.S. and international)
  * LLCs cannot issue stock
  * Ownership represented by members


![Home](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20825%20750'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
Sam & Melina are
Co-founders 
who started 
a C-Corp 
from  France. 
### C-Corporation (C-Corp)
A C-Corporation (C-Corp) is a type of business entity that is legally separate from its owners, providing strong liability protection. It’s the default corporation type in the U.S. and is often chosen by businesses that plan to grow and attract investors.
  * Limited liability protection for owners
  * Ability to raise capital by issuing stock
  * Ownership represented by shareholders
  * Management structure with more operating requirements


![Home](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20825%20750'%3E%3C/svg%3E)
Jessica is a 
Software Engineer
who started an 
S-Corp  from 
New York. 
### S-Corporation (S-Corp)
Only U.S. citizens or residents can be shareholders.
An S-Corporation (S-Corp) is a business structure that offers limited liability like a corporation but with the tax benefits of a pass-through entity. Profits and losses pass directly to the owners’ personal income, avoiding double taxation.
  * Limited liability protection for owners
  * Pass-through taxation
  * Ability to raise capital by issuing stock
  * Only U.S. citizens or residents can be shareholders
  * Limited to 100 shareholders or fewer

## FAQs
### Why should I get an LLC and a business bank account?
Forming an LLC and opening a business bank account are essential steps to protect your personal assets and streamline your finances. An LLC limits your personal liability in case of legal or financial issues, while a business bank account helps you separate personal and business finances, making tax preparation easier and ensuring a more professional image for your business.
### Do I need to be a US citizen to work with doola?
No, you don’t! We work with entrepreneurs from around the world to get their businesses incorporated. Don’t take our word for it, though; check out our [TrustPilot Page](https://www.doola.com/<https:/www.trustpilot.com/review/doola.com>) to hear what people globally have to say about doola.
### What is an LLC (Limited Liability Company)?
A limited liability company is a formal business structure (created as per state law) where the business is legally distinct from the owner(s). It may have a single owner in the case of a Single-Member LLC or multiple owners in the case of a Multi-Member LLC.
An LLC combines the perks of a corporation (protection against personal liability) and a partnership (pass-through taxation). Since the business has a separate legal existence, the members are not personally liable for the debts and obligations of the Company.
State laws stipulate how LLCs should be incorporated. Some states require specific documents, such as the articles of organization, membership agreement, etc., to be filed with the authorities.
Learn more about LLCs and how they work in [FREE ebook.](https://www.doola.com/<https:/www.doola.com/beginners-guide-to-llcs/>)
### What information do you need from me to get started?
We don't need any documents to get started. We just need a few pieces of info from you:
  * Your Company Name
  * Your Personal Address
  * Phone Number and Email (For contact purposes) 


Later in the process, you'll need a passport to set up your bank account.
### What is an ITIN?
An Individual Tax Identification Number (ITIN) can be used as an alternative for a Social Security Number (SSN) in some cases and is not a requirement in most cases. However, you will be required to have one if you wish to apply for a PayPal account or certain bank accounts. We walk you through how this process looks like in our [guide](https://www.doola.com/<https:/doola.com/blog/difference-between-an-ein-ssn-and-itin>)!

## All-in-one company formation services
#### Start Your U.S. Business
We help you start your business in the United States, ensuring compliance from day one.
Learn more ⟨27⟩
#### Business Documentation
Get essential documents for banking, taxes, and e-commerce, including an operating agreement and articles of organization.
Learn more ⟨28⟩
#### Registered Agent Service
We provide a trusted Registered Agent to receive important business documents on your behalf, keeping your business compliant.
Learn more ⟨29⟩
#### Sales Tax & Reseller Certificate
Setup your business for sales tax and get a reseller certificate, ensuring compliance while unlocking tax-exempt purchasing for your business.
Learn more ⟨30⟩
#### Dedicated Bookkeeping
We manage your books while our software syncs with your bank accounts and Stripe, tracking and categorizing every transaction.
Learn more ⟨2⟩
#### Business Taxes
We handle your annual tax paperwork with our in-house tax and CPA teams to maintain good standings and avoid hefty penalties.

## The quick path to forming your business
Start your business![right arrow⟨18⟩](https://www.doola.com/<https:/app.doola.com/>)
Free consultation⟨17⟩
Step 1
### Submit your information through our user-friendly Dashboard
To kick off the process, you’ll need to provide some basic information about your future business.
  * Company information (Preferred name, entity type, state, and a few other basics)
  * Members information (Legal name, address, ownership, and a few additional details)


15 minutes
Step 2
### Start your U.S. company in any of the 50 states
We help you set up everything you need to start your business in any state.
  * Company Formation in any U.S. state
  * Operating Agreement & Articles of Organization
  * Registered Agent Service for secure document handling


1 week (on average)
Step 3
### Secure your Business Documentation 
We secure your Business Documents needed for opening a business bank account, hiring employees, and filing taxes.
  * Essential Business Documents


1 – 2 business days (US residents)  4-6 weeks (on average) (non-US residents)
Step 4
### Set up yourU.S. bank account
Once you get your business documents, you can apply for a U.S. bank account through our partner portal
  * Business Documents required
  * Passport required (for international clients)


3 – 5 business days 
Step 5
### Run & growyour business
Your business is fully set up and compliant, so you’re ready to dive into your work with confidence.
  * Additional Services Keep your company on track with our bookkeeping and tax services.
  * Stay Compliant For full compliance support, consider starting with Total Compliance.


Start your business![right arrow⟨18⟩](https://www.doola.com/<https:/app.doola.com/>)
## Find the best structure for your needs
Take our quiz ⟨32⟩
  * LLC
  * C-Corp
  * S-Corp


![Home⟨33⟩]
Siddharth is an
Amazon Seller who
started a  US LLC
from  India.
### Limited Liability Companies (LLC)
A Limited Liability Company (LLC) is a flexible business structure in the U.S. that offers personal liability protection and can have one or multiple owners (called members). It’s popular among small business owners and entrepreneurs for its simplicity and tax flexibility.
  * Limited liability protection for owners
  * Simple management structure and easy to operate
  * Unlimited owners (U.S. and international)
  * LLCs cannot issue stock
  * Ownership represented by members


![Home⟨33⟩]
Sam & Melina are
Co-founders 
who started 
a C-Corp 
from  France. 
### C-Corporation (C-Corp)
A C-Corporation (C-Corp) is a type of business entity that is legally separate from its owners, providing strong liability protection. It’s the default corporation type in the U.S. and is often chosen by businesses that plan to grow and attract investors.
  * Limited liability protection for owners
  * Ability to raise capital by issuing stock
  * Ownership represented by shareholders
  * Management structure with more operating requirements


![Home⟨33⟩]
Jessica is a 
Software Engineer
who started an 
S-Corp  from 
New York. 
### S-Corporation (S-Corp)
Only U.S. citizens or residents can be shareholders.
An S-Corporation (S-Corp) is a business structure that offers limited liability like a corporation but with the tax benefits of a pass-through entity. Profits and losses pass directly to the owners’ personal income, avoiding double taxation.
  * Limited liability protection for owners
  * Pass-through taxation
  * Ability to raise capital by issuing stock
  * Only U.S. citizens or residents can be shareholders
  * Limited to 100 shareholders or fewer

## FAQs
### Why should I get an LLC and a business bank account?
Forming an LLC and opening a business bank account are essential steps to protect your personal assets and streamline your finances. An LLC limits your personal liability in case of legal or financial issues, while a business bank account helps you separate personal and business finances, making tax preparation easier and ensuring a more professional image for your business.
### Do I need to be a US citizen to work with doola?
No, you don’t! We work with entrepreneurs from around the world to get their businesses incorporated. Don’t take our word for it, though; check out our TrustPilot Page⟨50⟩ to hear what people globally have to say about doola.
### What is an LLC (Limited Liability Company)?
A limited liability company is a formal business structure (created as per state law) where the business is legally distinct from the owner(s). It may have a single owner in the case of a Single-Member LLC or multiple owners in the case of a Multi-Member LLC.
An LLC combines the perks of a corporation (protection against personal liability) and a partnership (pass-through taxation). Since the business has a separate legal existence, the members are not personally liable for the debts and obligations of the Company.
State laws stipulate how LLCs should be incorporated. Some states require specific documents, such as the articles of organization, membership agreement, etc., to be filed with the authorities.
Learn more about LLCs and how they work in FREE ebook.⟨51⟩
### What information do you need from me to get started?
We don't need any documents to get started. We just need a few pieces of info from you:
  * Your Company Name
  * Your Personal Address
  * Phone Number and Email (For contact purposes) 


Later in the process, you'll need a passport to set up your bank account.
### What is an ITIN?
An Individual Tax Identification Number (ITIN) can be used as an alternative for a Social Security Number (SSN) in some cases and is not a requirement in most cases. However, you will be required to have one if you wish to apply for a PayPal account or certain bank accounts. We walk you through how this process looks like in our guide⟨52⟩!
### Still have a question?
Schedule a free consultation⟨53⟩ with an expert from doola, today.

generated_description:
**Doola: Your Business-in-a-Box for LLC Formation**

Doola is an innovative startup based in New York, launched in 2020 and part of Y Combinator's Batch S20. Their mission? To provide a comprehensive "Business-in-a-Box" solution designed specifically for creators and online entrepreneurs. Doola simplifies the complex web of administrative tasks that come with starting a business by offering a seamless solution that covers everything from forming an LLC to managing compliance and tax filings.

When founders Aaron Epstein and his team recognized the challenges many creators faced in launching their ventures—especially those who wanted to focus on growth instead of paperwork—they decided to build doola, a platform that takes care of all the nitty-gritty details. Their user-friendly service has clients worldwide, making it possible for anyone to start a business in the U.S. without the usual headaches.

### Core Offerings
Doola’s platform includes a suite of essential services to support business formation and ongoing operations:

1. **Business Formation**: Streamlined registration of LLCs and other entities across all U.S. states.
2. **Bank Account Setup**: Assistance in securing a U.S. bank account necessary for business operations.
3. **Tax and Compliance Management**: In-house experts offer ongoing support for tax filings and compliance, ensuring businesses remain legally sound.
4. **Bookkeeping Services**: Doola's bookkeeping tools track transactions and sync with bank accounts, reducing the burden on business owners.
5. **Educational Resources**: They provide extensive resources like e-books, blogs, and community support to empower entrepreneurs with knowledge.

### Pricing
Doola offers various pricing plans to cater to different needs:
- **Starter Plan**: $297/year, covering essential services for LLC formation and registered agent support.
- **Total Compliance Plan**: $1,999/year, which includes comprehensive compliance services and tax filings.
- **Total Compliance Max**: $2,999/year, adding dedicated bookkeeping services for enhanced financial management.

### Future Aspirations
As doola continues to grow, their goal remains clear: to democratize business formation for aspiring entrepreneurs around the globe, providing them with the tools they need to succeed—all while they focus on what truly matters: building and growing their businesses.

So, whether you’re an entrepreneur looking to establish your first LLC or an experienced business owner needing a reliable partner for compliance, doola is there to support you through every step of your journey. 

### Learn More
Curious to see how doola can help you? Visit their website at [doola.com](https://www.doola.com) and start your business today.
